decision_conditions: Any replacement trees which within a period of five years from planting are removed, die or become seriously damaged/diseased shall be replaced within the next planting season (Oct 1st to April 30th) with trees of similar amenity value.Any replacement planting should be carried out with due consideration for overhead and underground services, property boundaries, buildings and potential maintenance. The eventual size of a specimen and the nature of its rooting structure should also be taken into account when choosing where to plant, in order to achieve the best result for your site. Four of the following will be a suitable replacement species:a) Norway maple 'Crimson King' (Acer platanoides 'Crimson King')b) Small-leaved Lime (Tilia cordata) c) Variegated holly (Ilex aquifolium 'Argenteomarginata')d) Manna ash (Fraxinus ornus)I have to warn you that if one of the above specified replacements is not planted by the end of the first planting season (Oct 1st to April 30th) following the proposed removals, a notice may be served under section 207 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). However, I trust that such action will not be necessary and I look forward to receiving your full cooperation in this matter. Please ensure that you inform the Council's Tree Officer (james.baker@kingston.gov.uk) with the provision of a photo once the replanting has taken place.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: 1. Lime x 17 across front - Re-Pollard back to previous pollard points, retaining all growth below 2 metres. 2. Holly - Reduce height to 2 metres tall 4x2m down to 2x2m.3. Holly - Fell (dead tree) 5. Ash sapling - Fell with (ADB)8. Box - Fell (dead tree)11. Box - Fell (dead tree) 12. Old Lime stool - Fell the decaying stem leaning and growing towards adjacent property to as close to ground level as possible13. Norway Maple - Fell14. Cherry - Cut back from adjacent building to give 2 metres clearance15. Bay - Cut back from building to give 2 metres clearance16. Box x 3 - Fell (dead trees) 17. Ash and Sycamore group - Cut back from building to give 2 metres clearance
